problem_text:
20.65. Given a complex irreducible character χ ∈Irr(G) of a finite group G, let Q(χ) denote the field extension of Q obtained by adjoining to Q all the values of χ. We say that a finite group G is k-rational if |Q(χ) : Q| divides k for every χ ∈Irr(G). Does there exist a real-valued function f such that if p is the order of a cyclic composition factor of a k-rational group G, then p ⩽f(k)?
If k = 1, then we know that p ⩽11 by a theorem of J. G. Thompson (J. Algebra, 319 (2008), 558–594).
A. Moret´o
